intro: Hypselodelphys scandens, commonly known as the climbing lily, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to climb using its twining stems. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and arranged alternately along the stem. Hypselodelphys scandens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
